user.biography:
1stDibs is a leading online marketplace for extraordinary design. 
Follow @1stdibsjewels for more.
Tag us in your #1stDibsFind.

node.text: In our latest edition of “On Location,” we’re thrilled to showcase the new home collection (@sirianointeriors) by award-winning fashion designer and CFDA member Christian Siriano (@csiriano), which is debuting exclusively on 1stDibs. He takes us into his “dusty but fabulous” studio for a behind-the-scenes peek at his beautifully crafted work. As with his statement-making clothes, Christian’s furniture designs all start with a sketch and are inspired by everything from candy (see the gumdrop stool) to old movies and picnics in the park. Click the link in bio to shop the chic, sartorially-inspired collection.

node.text: Join us for a new edition of “On Location,” in which we visit fine art embroiderer @richardsaja in his Catskill, NY, studio. Richard’s work is a kind of meditation in which time evaporates in a blur of color and stitching. He transforms classical mediums—toile fabrics and tapestries—with what he refers to as “historical inaccuracy.” Surrounded by a rainbow palette of embroidery floss, he takes a coloring book approach to pastoral scenes. They emerge infused with contemporary issues and cultural memes that celebrate difference and encourage tolerance. Click the link in bio to discover more of Richard’s enchanting embroidered, decorative, graphic and fine art pieces.

node.title: On Location With Fine Art Embroiderer Richard Saja

node.text: In the past few years, Hudson, NY, has gone from “destination-on-the-rise” to full-blown hot spot. Paris Grant (@miss_parisg), head of interiors at @reddymadedesign in New York City, dons a chic lace mask and takes us on a whirlwind tour of some of this upstate town’s incredible array of antiques shops and design galleries. Like a kid in a candy store, she displays an infectious enthusiasm for the many treasures on display. Click the link in bio to read more in Introspective. 🎥: @harry_zernike

node.title: In Hudson, Decorator Paris Grant Takes Us on a Hunt for Design Treasures

node.text: Is an engagement ring from the Victorian era (1837-1901) calling your name? These feminine designs often feature small rose cut or old mine cut diamonds, along with ornate patterns hammered into the gold settings. Romantic motifs include hearts, flowers and stars, but the swirling two-stone toi et moi rings are perhaps the ultimate symbol of an eternal bond. Click the link in bio to watch the full video on shopping for vintage or antique rings.

node.title: Victorian, Edwardian and Art Deco Rings on 1stDibs

node.text: Our latest edition of “On Location: Personal Space” takes us into the light-drenched Brooklyn duplex of Milan-born designer Mario Milana and his wife, the Colombian actress Gabriella Campagna. Their home beautifully embodies the same mix of warm, organic elements and refined geometries found in Mario’s work. His simple and efficient morning routine sets him up for a quarantine day of painting, reading, soaking up sunshine in the back garden and more meditation—seated in his low-slung Asana chair, of course!

node.title: On Location with 1stdibs maker Mario Milana

node.text: Next up in our new series, “On Location: Personal Space,” we spend a little time with potter, designer and author @jonathanadler. Where better to shelter in place alongside his husband—writer and fashion icon (and videographer!) @simondoonan— and their dog Foxy than the gorgeous home they share on Shelter Island? With its bright palette, groovy furnishings and sweeping ocean views, it’s the ideal place to work and play. Surrounded by his own creations and collections, Jonathan is managing to drink tea, practice his pull-ups and do a lot of reading.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by 1stDibs on July 22, 2021 tagging @nasa. May be an image of outdoors and text.

node.text: Photographed by fellow American and @nasa astronaut James McDivitt during the 1965 Gemini 4 moon mission, Ed White is seen here outside the spacecraft over Hawaii. NASA photographs from this era— a scientific and artistic feat—captured the beautiful rocky moonscape and the lunar experiments conducted by the astronauts. These unprecedented images inspired the popular imagination. Click the link in bio to discover more from our collection of The Most Beautiful Things, an extraordinary cache of treasures curated by our editors. 📸: 99Prints

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by 1stDibs on July 21, 2021 tagging @galerie.philia. May be an image of furniture and living room.

node.text: For his award-winning Portuguese Roots (P.R.) Lounge chair, designer Alexandre Caldas drew on his own relationship to nature and on Portugal’s centuries-old woodworking traditions. The long lines of this design, stretched to the limit, create an inviting sense of comfort to the eye and the body. The wood from which it is made connects Caldas to his own environment and the trees he loves. The chair and its name allude to his belief that our roots must be preserved and maintained in order to keep inspiring us today and for generations to come. Click the link in bio to shop. 📸: @galerie.philia

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by 1stDibs on July 20, 2021 tagging @morentz_gallery.

node.text: Whether you open with the French Defense or the Queen’s Gambit, we salute your moves on this #InternationalChessDay. It’s been scientifically proven that chess improves your memory, cognitive abilities and strategic thinking, so why not indulge in a board whose gorgeous looks encourage you to play with frequency? This plexiglass chess set was designed in 1979 by Victor Vasarely, renowned for his work in optical art. A colorful print under a transparent top structures the chess field and fits surroundings with a pattern of round forms in angular fields. The chess pieces are abstract forms that are clear for one player and frosted for the opponent. Click the link in bio to make your move. 📸: @morentz_gallery

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by 1stDibs on July 20, 2021 tagging @morentz_gallery.
Photo by 1stDibs on July 20, 2021.
Photo by 1stDibs on July 19, 2021. May be an image of furniture and bedroom.

node.text: Oh, life is but a dream in a well-appointed bedroom. The best sleep spaces are filled with purpose and personality — from the fluffy pillows to the idiosyncratic nightstand decor. In this L.A. bungalow, designer @madelinedstuart deployed Spanish-inspired antiques, plush textures and a warm Mediterranean palette that stayed true to the home's architecture and the owners themselves. How many sleeps until you update your bedroom? 1stDibs offers a collection of furniture, fine art, bedding and lighting that will beckon and bewitch you each (and every) waking moment. Click the link in our bio to start shopping. 📸: Trevor Tondro

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by 1stDibs on July 18, 2021 tagging @amberinteriors. May be an image of furniture and kitchen.

node.text: Faraway places swim in and out of the imagination on a visit to this Malibu kitchen, the work of #1stDibs50 designer @amberinteriors. Maybe it’s the French limestone flooring from Exquisite Surfaces, the English-style oak cabinetry, the vintage oriental carpet or the copper over-counter lanterns from Ann Morris, which have a Greek taverna vibe. Choose your transporting detail — each somehow magnifies the others, complementing rather than competing. “I wouldn’t say there is necessarily one standout feature,” Amber Lewis explains. “But the mix of natural materials and the earthy tones give this kitchen a cozy feel, even though the room is quite grand.” Click the link in bio to see more from this year’s 1stDibs 50. 📸: @tessaneustadt

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by 1stDibs on July 17, 2021 tagging @phaidonsnaps, and @monacellipress. May be an image of 1 person.

node.text: For a limited time only, enjoy 25% off select titles during the @Phaidonsnaps and @monacellipress Summer Sale. Dive headfirst into a range of splashy subjects including art, architecture, design, photography, travel, food and fashion — the page-turning possibilities are endless. Click the link in our bio and do Summer 2021 by the book. 📸: @phaidonsnaps

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by 1stDibs on July 16, 2021 tagging @studio_kate_. May be an image of living room.

node.text: Calling all Trade 1st members. Is your firm ready for its closeup? If so, we want to feature YOU on our Designers to Watch Pinterest board. To be eligible for this unique opportunity, simply publish a project with at least one photo, to your Designer Portfolio now through August 10. You'll also be considered for editorial and marketing placements across 1stDibs.com — which will give priceless exposure to your work. Click the link in bio to create and upload your Portfolio, or to learn about all the benefits of the Trade 1st program. 📸: @mareehomer.photography for @studio_kate_

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by 1stDibs on July 15, 2021 tagging @jjjmcdonald, and @kitte.ateliers.platform.

node.text: J McDonald (@jjjmcdonald), an artist and designer based in Brooklyn, NY, creates otherworldly furniture and sculptures that illuminate the tensions and dialogues between humans and the environment. His work, offered by @kitte.ateliers.platform, unites refined minimalism together with an organic and sculptural animism. The Saturn Lamp, a contemporary piece that’s part of a handmade limited edition, shows off his facility with steel. Click the link in bio to shop. 📸: @martynaszcz

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by 1stDibs on July 14, 2021 tagging @emotional_brands. May be an image of furniture and bedroom.

node.text: One of the most beautiful muses of 1960s Hollywood, Linda Marshall was known for her talent and seductive beauty. Ottiu, designers of luxurious mid-century-inspired beds, created this homage to her that features lush curves upholstered in opulent velvet. The  Linda bed has an expansive capitonné headboard and a base lacquered in metallic gold. To drift off to sleep in this is akin to floating on cloud nine. Click the link in bio to discover more. 📸: @emotional_brands

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by 1stDibs on July 13, 2021 tagging @artbrokerdesign. May be an image of 2 people.

node.text: With his jaunty mustache and portfolio of thought-provoking works, Salvador Dalí has quite literally become the face of surrealism. His dream-like, avant-garde creativity spanned many mediums, from paintings to sculptures. It also redefined how the visual arts can be used to understand the subconscious, and that has influenced artists ever since. As a tribute, 1stDibs' in-house art experts have curated a collection of pieces by artists to explore if you love Dalí. Click the link in bio or watch our stories now to get swept up in the spirit of Dalí. 📸: @artbrokerdesign @kcontemporaryart @vivamus_gallery @bleachboxphotographygallery @duplexdsgn @gallerynapiorkowska

node.text: Note to self, design lovers: You're invited to explore @_sightunseen_’s Summer 2021 collection, exclusively on 1stDibs. This influential curator of contemporary design is offering works by independent makers and avant-garde conceptual designers. Be the first to shop these extraordinary pieces today — click the link in our bio and find something fantastical. 📸: @_sightunseen_ @objectsandideas

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by 1stDibs on July 11, 2021 tagging @fernsantini. May be an image of furniture and living room.

node.text: Feeling both entrepreneurial and philanthropic, Austin-based interior designer @fernsantini partnered with a team of architects, builders and artisans to create a spec house that would celebrate music and benefit local musicians. While on the market, the house served as the setting for events to benefit the Health Alliance for Austin Musicians (@myhaam), which provides affordable health care to Austin’s low-income working musicians. Once it sold—to an Austin businessman before the opening night party—HAAM also received a portion of the purchase price. In the great room of this “free-wheeling, irreverent” home, Santini arranged a gallery wall of mid-century oil paintings that hang over a Mcintosh system housed in open cabinets. Above BDDW sling chairs and a Shota Yamaguchi settee, seven Fontana Arte fixtures cast enticing shadows. Click the link in bio to more in our Introspective feature. 📸: @douglasfriedman
